To M
r
Secret
r
Oc
t
7. 89

page.lettertext:
Belgia 1589 7 October To M
r
Secretary from M
r
Bodly
It may please yo
r
H. wh
r
as I was lately writen by my
LL.
of
e Counsell to sollicit
e
gen
r
all states
about
e fortifica
o
ns of
Oostende.
I have used asmuch instance as I could in
t
behalfe
but theyr Answers have bin alwayes very dilatory, for
what respect I cannot c
r
tify yo
r
H. but as far as I c
a
ceave they can not [.] w
th
those of
Zeland
about disbursing
of
e mony & w
th
all I see there ys great want of mony on
all hand
. They do also say
t
the danger of
e place
is more amplifyed in woordes then ther ys cause indeed.
And wheth
r
besydes they have bin moved to attend theyr
Deputyes retourne before any resolu
o
n be taken. I c
a
affirme
nothing for c
r
tayne. But I have found th
e
very backward &
free of shift
& excuses in this cause. p
r
tending
t
they were
[pressed] w
th
oth
r
matters of great
r
importance & so putting mee
of from day to day Nev
r
theles by much calling upon them
I have obtayned at length that they are cont
e
ted to appoint a
tyme to consult & take some ord
r
for
e relief of
e towne.
wh
r
in they ar buisyed at
is p
nt
& as any thing ys resolved I
will signify to my LL.
Count Maurice
ys lately gon for
Northholland
w
th
c
r
tayne others of
e gen
r
all States to accord an
old contention between some of
e greater &
e lesser Townes
astouching
e n
o
ber of Deputyes w
ch
each Towne p
r
tendeth to
send to
e Colledge & Counsell of those quarters w
ch
is thought will
minister occasyon of greater inconvenience yf yt be not quieted
in tyme. Wee ar newly adv
r
tised
t
the souldiers of
Liefkes
Hoeck
ov
r
against
Lillo
are in munity w[ch is thought to growe about
theyr paye of 48 dayes to
e moneth. for
e present appeasing
wh
r
of
e
Counsell of State
ys very carefull least theyr example
should provoke oth
r
garrisons to do
e like. The disc
o
tentment
of
Schenck
soulders w
ch
were lefte in his fort at
Sgrave weert
doth encrease more & nowe chainge made [to] charge among
them selves of theyr officers. Howbeyt ther is mony sent of late
& such ord
r
taken as the state will
mitt to
cure theyr c
o
tentment
Mons
r
du Haldaine
whom
e
F
King
sent hith
r
to rx
e mony
that was
mised to be lent is de
ted fr
o
hens in Company of those
Deputyes
t
were appointed for
Fraunce
having Rxd as I und
r
stand
in redy paym
e
t more then
e half of that w
ch
was
mised.
The
Count Newen
r
being lately at
Arnham
& busied about
e
direction of c
r
tayne arteficiall fyres by
e negilience of one of
his pages
t
caried a light c
r
tayne powd
r
tooke fyre wh
r
by a great
te of the house was blowen up. one
Cap
t
Danis
an ingener slaine
&
e Count himself very dangerosly blasted & brused w
th
e fall of
a wall. So as any men think he will hardly escape yt. Th
r
uppon
e
charge of victualling
Berck
was c
o
mitted to
e Conduct of
Count
Oversteyn
.
S
r
Francis Vere
&
e
Baron of Potlits
. who as we ar
adv
r
tysed
e second of
is moneth in
e open face of
e Ennemy conveyed
into
e Towne 24 cart
lad
e
w
th
victuall & oth
r
necessaries & w
th
in
fol.141v
2 daies after m
r
ched theth
r
ward
w
th
more
visyon.
e successe wh
r
of
is not yet c
r
tified hether. Fr
o
Grave
& those qwuarters wher
e Ennemy lieth ther ys freshe brute come hether, that
e
D.
of Parma
ys for c
r
tayn dead w
ch
is not yet oth
r
wise confirmed.
The Bearer heerof of ys one
M
r
Yacksly
an English gentleman
who served sometyme
e
Elector of Collen
& by him was rec
o
mended
to
e
s
vice of
Count Hohenlo
w
th
whom he hath continued all
e
tyme of his late absence in
Germany.
He hath bin very well
used by
e Count & is comended by divers for his honest &
discrete demeano
r
. the occasyon of his coming to
England
yo
r
H. will
know by him self & by his l
re
s.
M
r
Dier
is newly heere
arrived & upon his de
ture for
Amsterdam
wherw
th
I take my
humble leave Hage 7
th
Octob
r
89.
